scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] frowns slightly while [Bob] crosses his arms. You mentioned that if the situation keeps happening, maybe it's time for the team to learn to manage without you during your leave.
scenes.description: [Bob] uncrosses his arms and says, 'You might be right, [Alex], but how do you plan to enforce that? It could create tension among the team.'

options.text: It's something we should discuss as a team and set clear expectations.
options.analysis: You promote open communication and collaboration, showing good emotional perception and empathy while maintaining balance.

options.text: I see your point, Bob. Maybe I need to have a one-on-one with the team lead about setting boundaries.
options.analysis: You agree with the concern, showing good self-regulation and willingness to set boundaries, but moderate motivation.

options.text: If it creates tension, then maybe it's a sign that the team needs to be more self-reliant.
options.analysis: You take a firm stance, emphasizing the need for team independence, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.
